articles.author: Norihiko Shirouzu
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) has combined a series of innovations to make a technological breakthrough that could transform the way it makes electric vehicles and help Elon Musk achieve his aim of halving production costs, five people familiar with the move said.
articles.title: Gigacasting 2.0: Tesla reinvents carmaking with quiet breakthrough

articles.author: Manya Saini, Niket Nishant, Laura Matthews
articles.description: SoftBank's Arm Holdings (ARM.O) was set to fetch a valuation of up to $64.1 billion in its Nasdaq debut on Thursday, as shares of the chip designer were set to blow past their offer price.
articles.title: SoftBank's Arm eyes up to $64.1 bln valuation in likely stellar Nasdaq debut

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski
articles.description: Thirty-one years ago, cable TV pioneer John Malone predicted customers would have as many as 500 channels in their living rooms.
articles.title: Disney, Charter’s Spectrum deal will reshape media -executives

articles.author: Ankika Biswas, Shristi A
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Thursday as hotter-than-expected economic data did not dent hopes of a pause in rate hikes in September, while investors awaited Arm Holdings' stock market debut.
articles.title: Wall St rises as economic data fails to dent rate-pause hopes; Arm debut in focus

articles.author: Marine Strauss, Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Belgium said on Thursday it would review the potential health risks linked to Apple's iPhone 12, becoming the latest European country to react after France ordered a halt to sales citing breaches of radiation exposure limits.
articles.title: Belgium reviews Apple's iPhone 12 after France halts sales over radiation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. retail sales increased more than expected in August as higher gasoline prices boosted receipts at service stations.
articles.title: Higher gasoline prices lift US retail sales in August; weekly jobless claims rise slightly

articles.author: Ludwig Burger, Patricia Weiss
articles.description: Bayer's (BAYGn.DE) new CEO plans to cut management jobs to speed up decision-making as a first step to overhaul the embattled German industrial group, which is facing investor pressure to break up, three people familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Bayer's new CEO plans to cut management jobs in prelude to overhaul

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: U.S. automakers and union negotiators offered little hope a deal would be reached on Thursday to avoid a midnight walkoff that would be the United Auto Workers' first-ever simultaneous strike against the Detroit Three carmakers.
articles.title: Detroit Three strike deadline nears as sides remain far apart

articles.author: Francesco Canepa, Balazs Koranyi
articles.description: The European Central Bank raised its key interest rate to a record high of 4% on Thursday but, with the euro zone economy in the doldrums, signalled that the hike, its 10th in a 14-month-long fight against inflation, was likely to be its last.
articles.title: ECB raises rates to record high, signals end to hikes

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: A NASA panel recommended in a report issued on Thursday that the U.S. space agency increase its efforts to gather information on unidentified objects in the sky - labeled "unidentified anomalous phenomenon," or UAP, by the government - and play a larger role in helping the Pentagon detect them.
articles.title: NASA panel calls for agency to play larger role in studying UFOs
